reviews.review_msg: Peter was a good prof. His lectures may be a little dry, but the class and content is easy to understand. There's also a class field trip. 1 midterm and the rest are projects/paper. He is a knowledgable/friendly teacher who has tons of experience in the field. However, his voice for 3 hours straight can make it a little hard to listen to.

I was a little disappointed in this course. It was really easy for a 400-level, but I didn't learn as much as I had hoped I would. Peter is a pioneer in emergency communications, which makes him an amazing resource, but unless you plan on going into that field, what you learn is not going to be particularly useful.

I thought that Peter was a great professor, one of the better ones at this school. It's clear he has a great interest in disaster mitigation and preparedness, and he brings a lot of experience as well, being on the forefront of his field in BC. He is responsive to emails and enjoys helping students succeed. The course was also relatively easy.

Anderson is such a dud.  I have attentended every class and am still leaving with no more knowledge then I started with.  The class, Mitigating Disasters, might seem like an intersting subject, but Andersons boring dull voice for 3 hours tears it to pieces.  This class was a disaster.  I will never take another class with him, even if it was free.
Great professor! Really cares about teaching and his students. I highly recommend his classes. Extremely intelligent
great TA, really cares about his students

Unclear speech and unhelpful. "You had a family emergency? The teacher had gone through it in class. Too bad you missed the tutorial." That's the kind of speech that you are likely to get. Good for ya if you didn't get that little speech.

I took a few CMNS classes with Anderson and I must say, he gets 2 thumbs up!~  His classes are very interesting and he knows his stuff. I loved all his classes. As a CMNS major, Anderson is the best prof I ever had.
